What does the `OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER` option do in Verus?

The `OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER` option in Verus, set to 1024, determines where top-level ID and currency registration occur. When this option is not set on a gateway, these registrations happen on the launch chain.

ill publish prices
OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER = 1024  // when not set on a gateway, top level ID and currency registration happen on launch chain
OPTION_NFT_TOKEN = 2048        // single satoshi NFT token, tokenizes control over the root ID
```
How does the `OPTION_NFT_TOKEN` option work in Verus?

The `OPTION_NFT_TOKEN` option in Verus, set to 2048, enables the creation of a single satoshi NFT (non-fungible token) that tokenizes control over the root ID. This allows for decentralized control and management of the root ID.

ill publish prices
OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER = 1024  // when not set on a gateway, top level ID and currency registration happen on launch chain
OPTION_NFT_TOKEN = 2048        // single satoshi NFT token, tokenizes control over the root ID
```
